talk.author: did:plc:rg6we7j27afow3hvgecd6xpn
talk.utter:
There are DOZENS of think pieces on those exact people, though. They're constantly referred to and interviewed. We're  constantly asked to reach out to them.

Has anyone in the major media interviewing them ever asked them to reach back?

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: Why would a journalist do that? That's not their job.

talk.author: did:plc:rg6we7j27afow3hvgecd6xpn
talk.utter:
Why would a journalist ever ask a slightly challenging question in an interview?  Why would a journalist ever notice a disparity in who they interview and who they never bother to interview?

Yes, both of those are parts of their job.

talk.author: did:plc:rg6we7j27afow3hvgecd6xpn
talk.utter:
Why would a journalist ever ask a slightly challenging question in an interview?  Why would a journalist ever notice a disparity in who they interview and who they never bother to interview?

Yes, both of those are parts of their job.

talk.author: did:plc:ruowg3jpbxrz5kogawrchstj
talk.utter: "Asking them to reach back" is not a challenging question. It's a request.

talk.author: did:plc:rg6we7j27afow3hvgecd6xpn
talk.utter: Then ask them if they ever had tried to reach back. Rephrasing it by two whole words makes it a question.
